comment._content: That would have swayed around badly.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: I am not convinced that this is double bay in 1898

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Google Maps Street View - g.co/maps/f4ncv 1907 Interactive map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-db66-sd&rgn=0.4...
"This line [King St / Ocean St, Edgecliff cable tramway] was extended to Rose Bay in 1898, the extension being of electrified track, with electric services commenced in October. Power was generated in the Cable Tram Powerhouse and electric cars were hauled to this track over the cable line by the cable cars."
from - www.railpage.org.au/tram/goddmack.html , section 2.4.3. Also there is a very similar view (see the foreground rocks!) here - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=14884 - I wonder if the photographer of this photo is also Albert James Perier ? Q.E.D.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Slightly further up the street,  the single line went into two - Charles Kerry photo -

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] The similar view pic (complete with rocks in middle of road!) appears in this 1898 Sydney Mail article - news.google.com/newspapers?id=pVZVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=npUDA...
